metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46873 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Because Firefox did not implement the unsafe-hashes CSP directive, an attacker who was able to inject markup into a page otherwise protected by a Content Security Policy may have been able to inject executable script. This would be severely constrained by the specified Content Security Policy of the document. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46873` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
